description: Even though the aggregate_multitenancy_isolation says it can filter on multiple tenants it currently doesn't.
title: aggregate_multitenancy_isolation doesn't work with multiple tenants

comments.content: Even though the aggregate_multitenancy_isolation says it can filter on multiple tenants it currently doesn't.

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/148807
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/148807
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=45b385982f29019ff86a7b85d25028131ecd8059
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 45b385982f29019ff86a7b85d25028131ecd8059
Author: Sam Morrison <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Jan 21 17:30:15 2015 +1100

    Support specifing multiple values for aggregate keys
    
    Currently the following filters are written as though they support multiple values:
     * aggregate_image_properties_isolation.py
     * aggregate_instance_extra_specs.py
     * aggregate_multitenancy_isolation_filter
     * availability_zone_filter.py
    
    This commit adds support to the underlying helper method to support
    specifying multiple values separated by a comma.
    
    This change for example allows operators to set multiple tenants by using a comma
    separated list.
    
    eg. filter_tenant_id: "tenantid1,tenantid2"
    
    DocImpact:
    Closes-Bug: #1413087
    Change-Id: I010e85ff4c29171c4be6d7a7209dbf2d55da0b64
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
